tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE experiments (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  nanostructure_id INT,
  biomolecule_id INT,
  experiment_date DATE,
  result TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE experiments (
  experiment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  experiment_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  nanostructure_id INT NOT NULL,
  biomolecule_id INT NOT NULL,
  experiment_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE experiment_results (
  result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  experiment_id INT,
  nanostructure_id INT,
  biomolecule_id INT,
  result_data TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE nanostructures ( id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, size FLOAT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL );

CREATE TABLE biomolecules ( id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, structure TEXT NOT NULL, molecular_weight FLOAT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL );

CREATE TABLE experiments ( id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, description TEXT, date_conducted DATE NOT NULL, location VARCHAR(100), created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE results ( id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, experiment_id INT NOT NULL, result TEXT NOT NULL, analysis TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL );

CREATE TABLE researchers ( id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, affiliation VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, updated_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL );
